summary: Can we just admit DC comics and Marvel comics are both good and the only real difference between the two is Marvel knows how to...
body: Can we just admit DC comics and Marvel comics are both good and the only real difference between the two is Marvel knows how to make movies and the production staff for DC movies is basically hundreds of wild animals in a computer lab and it’s all basically held together by 3 shoe strings and a pack of gum given to like the 5 people who know what they are doing and for some reason it’s all partially funded by the Secretary of the Treasury of the United States.

blog.name: why-i-love-comics
blog.title: A blog dedicated to all your favorite moments
blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

body:
never leave again

w/c: 903

warnings: crying?

summary: reuniting with peter after the events of infinity war

a/n: i figured this would be a soft concept to write about and endgame is coming out super soon and i miss peter soooo yeah enjoy. side note: i’ve written two requests so far and i’ll post them soon! send more! (prompts here if y’all want them)

-

almost a year. it‘s been almost a year since the event that flipped your world upside down. the decimation is what they call it. you’re not so sure what that means, but you are sure of one thing: you’ll never be the same.

losing hundreds of classmates from the decimation broke your heart. finding out peter was gone too ripped it out of your chest.

ned was the one to tell you. he found out from aunt may, and she found out from tony stark. peter left the bus going to the moma for his and ned’s field trip and went into space to fight beside tony. you want to be proud of him. you want to have hope that he’ll come back. but you know all too well the chances of that happening are little to none.

peter isn’t there to make funny faces at across the room during class. or watch the sunset with you from the tops of high buildings. or sing along way too loudly to your favorite songs. it’s just you and yourself.

your family, ned, mj, and may have been trying, but failing, to cheer you up for so long. if the people you‘re closest to can’t even help, no one can.

for the first time in a while, though, the empty city seems full again. the sky isn’t filled with dust and clouds. something is different.

you know it’s true when you hear a shy knock at may’s apartment door while visiting her after school one day. you open it to reveal peter benjamin parker standing behind.

“you’re back!” you practically cry out and launch yourself at peter.

he catches you weakly, melting into your touch as you wrap your arms around him tighter than you ever have before. hot tears are streaming down his face when he rests his forehead against yours.

may watches you two from the kitchen with a hand clasped over her mouth, hardly able to believe what she’s seeing.

“i’m back. i’m back.” peter assures himself and you.

“what happened? are you okay? wait, no. you don’t have to answer. just-“

peter interrupts your rambling. “look at me.”

you really look at him for the first time in what feels like forever. dark circles under his eyes, cuts on his tear stained cheeks and chin, his lips swollen.

“i um…i can’t say much. i don’t know how to or what to. but i’m back. and i’m right here with you. i’m not going anywhere.” he cups both of your cheeks softly but urgently, almost like he needs the contact.

“you’re right. i’m just happy to see you again. god, i missed you so much.” you place one of your hands on top of peter’s just feather lightly, not wanting to overwhelm him.

“i missed you too.” he runs his thumb across your lower lip a few times.

there are so many things that you actually want to say, that you’ve been waiting to say, but they don’t matter anymore. all you care about in this moment is that your favorite person is home and safe.

“peter?” may slowly stands from her chair in the kitchen.

you pull away from peter and give him an encouraging look to go to his aunt.

he quickly makes his way over and hides himself in her arms as she kisses his forehead. she tells him that everything is going to be okay.

you feel tears prick your own eyes watching them as you close the apartment door and lean against it.

“come over here, y/n.” may opens one of her arms to you and you join their hug. peter leans into you slightly more.

she eventually leaves you both alone after hugging peter a few more times and making sure he feels alright. he says he does, but you suspect that isn’t true.

you’re helping peter settle back into his room when he pats the spot next to him on his bed.

you sit and he rests his head on your shoulder, looking up at you.

“i still don’t even know what happened. it was…” he trails off for a moment. “it was so scary. one of the scariest things i’ve been through. i kept trying to stay, and it hurt. it really hurt.” peter’s voice breaks while he opens up.

you’re relieved he stopped holding everything in, but your heart aches once again hearing the words come out of his mouth.

“it shouldn’t have been you, pete. i’m so sorry.” you brush a bit of hair out of his face.

“not your fault, baby.” he speaks with a shaky voice while rubbing at his teary eyes.

you don’t say a word. instead, you just let him cry quietly into your shoulder.

it hadn’t occurred to you until now how much the decimation truly affected peter. even though you got hurt too, you can’t relate to the things he went through. all you can do is be here for him.

it takes you some time, but you find the right words to say.

“you know how may said everything is gonna be okay? she was right. everything is gonna be okay. maybe not right now, but soon.” you twirl one of his curls with your fingers.

“i hope so.” he sniffles and meets your eyes again.

“hey, pete?”

“hm?”

“never leave again.”

he holds up his pinky and links it with yours.

“i won’t. you have my word.”

reblog.comment:
never leave again

w/c: 903

warnings: crying?

it takes you some time, but you find the right words to say.

“you know how may said everything is gonna be okay? she was right. everything is gonna be okay. maybe not right now, but soon.” you twirl one of his curls with your fingers.

“hey, pete?”

“hm?”

blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

blog.name: scavengingforwords

Fandom!
(largely Marvel Fandom)
blog.description: I'm a nerd who gets sucked into tons of fandoms, here is where I will gather my fandom love. Let’s be honest though, at this point this is like 99.99% Marvel and of that percentage 99% of it is Avengers Academy related.

blog.name: itsanerdlife
blog.title: Ama
blog.description: 20's II Married. || Hufflepuff. II Kingsman - Marvel Fanfic Writer. II Beta Reader// Editor // Partner @Mo320 II Master List

title: Ex Games 5/20
body:
Pairing: Clint Barton x Romanov!Reader

Warning: Language. Lies. Arguing.

Everyone has secrets. Especially the Romanov sisters. When you end up in a sticky situation you find yourself at the gate of Avengers Compound, looking for your sister, Nat. But little did you know your past was on the other side of the gate as well.
Clint Barton, he broke your heart and destroyed you, years ago. Tricks and secrets are a game you and your sister are well trained in, and you’re out to make Clint jealous. Payback is only fair, right? But Clint’s done playing games, yours and your sisters. Truth is coming out and you can’t stay away from Clint.

Upast’ zamertvo – Drop Dead


He looks from the cookie in his hand to her disappearing upstairs. He sighs, shaking his head. He knew it was pushing her. She was ready. He was being selfish and knew it, but she was so close he didn’t know what he was supposed to do with that. He heads through the house, voices pulling his attention. Steve, Sam and Peter are standing in the living room.

“We see you Parker.” Steve comments.

“I’m just being nice.” Peter grins. Clearly none of them realize he’s joined. He leans on the frame of the opening.

“You’re trying to get points with her.” Sam points out.

“Jealous?” Peter chuckles.

“Bribing her with cookies?” Sam scuffs. “Child’s play.”

“Cause you’ve what got an in with her? What with the shot?” Peter snorts. Clint smirks, they were arguing about Y/N, that was cute. Like do they know she would literally eat them alive just cause she was bored.

“PTSD, we have something in common. A comfort of know she’s not alone.” Sam gives a smug smile.

“You’re both wasting your time.” Steve chuckles.

“What are you going to do?” Peter laughs. “Give her a fight for freedom speech?” He scuffs.

“Or just blush and babble in the corner till she notices you?” Sam adds.

“Beside why would she want with an old guy?” Peter snorts. Clint shakes his head, this kid and his old comment.

“I mean,” Steve shrugs, lifting the bottom of his shirt, flashing off his stomach. “and I’m the perfect guy. Literally.” Steve smirks. Clint shrugs, nodding, Steve wasn’t wrong. He was literally the perfect guy, scientifically perfected.

“I’m a genius.” Peter shrugs, lifting his own T-shirt, showing off his own stomach. “Besides, touch her mind, and her body will follow.” Peter throws his hand up. “Boom.” He has a smug grin on his face.

“Damn, that was fucking good.” Sam and Steve exchange a look. Peter shrugs, looking like he won. He turns, stopping when he see Clint.

He bites into the cookie, chuckling.

“Oh, hey Clint.” Peter looks a little awkward suddenly. The other two look as well.

“You know she will pick you apart for fun than eat you alive, right?” Clint chuckles.

“Who?” The three of them ask together.

“All of you.” He laughs, shaking his head. “Don’t believe that sweet smile and bat of her eyes. You know a widow lures her prey in with the promise of sex, than she kills him.” He nods.

“How do you know?” Steve looks as if he wasn’t sure if he should believe him.

“I’ve known the Romanov Sisters for many, many years. I’ve watched her work.” He shrugs. She was too much for sweet, innocent and good guys like Steve, Peter and Sam. She was dark, damaged and a little wild.

“That doesn’t put me off.” Sam shrugs.

“Spiders are good for each other.” Peter smirks.

“Just means she needs real strength to handle her.” Steve nods. Clint laughs, popping the rest of the cookie into his mouth.

“She’ll eat you alive for sport.” He chuckles, walking away.



——-



He jogs to catch up to her in the hallway of the training unit.

“Y/N?” She stops turning to look at him.

“What do you want, Barton?” She rolls her eyes.

“What are you doing?” He tries to ask calmly.

“Going to team training?” She shrugs.

“No with the guys.” He sighs. “You have Steve, Sam and Peter tripping over themselves to get your attention.” He points out.

“Why does it matter to you?” She hisses. She had a point. He didn’t have a right to care, he ended things with her.

“We both know you would destroy them.” He lifts a brow.

“Sort of like you did me.” She smirks. She shifts, suddenly cold and smug.

“Y/N,” he grinds out.

“Shove that apology, Barton.” She hisses. “I don’t want it or need it. What I do with anyone else is none of your business. Understand?” She lifts a brow.

“Are we really,”

“What? Don’t act like you’re jealous.” She snorts, cutting him off.

“And if it’s not an act?” He asks. Shock registers on her face suddenly.

“Why would you be jealous? Remember, you didn’t want me.” She bites out.

“Maybe I didn’t have a choice, Y/N.” He retorts. “Maybe you don’t know the story.”

“Maybe I don’t want it anymore.” She snaps. “If you are jealous, get used to it.” She shrugs.

“God damn it, Y/N.” He growls, getting annoyed with her.

“Too many years too late.” She hisses. “I don’t want your excuses cause you’re jealous someone wants me, when you discarded me.” She reminds him. She might as well have kicked him in the ribs.

“Walking away doesn’t change we need to talk.” He calls as she turns getting a short distance.

“Upast’ zamertvo.” She flips him off. ‘Drop dead’ from a Russian is a hell of a threat.

“Yeah. Yeah.” Clint calls. “I probably would if you talked to me.” He sighs. She doesn’t stop or turn back, heading into the training room. Leaving him stewing in his own bad discussions and regret alone in the hallway.

Everything Peaches 2/6/19:

trail.content:
Pairing: Clint Barton x Romanov!Reader

Warning: Language. Lies. Arguing.

Everyone has secrets. Especially the Romanov sisters. When you end up in a sticky situation you find yourself at the gate of Avengers Compound, looking for your sister, Nat. But little did you know your past was on the other side of the gate as well.
Clint Barton, he broke your heart and destroyed you, years ago. Tricks and secrets are a game you and your sister are well trained in, and you’re out to make Clint jealous. Payback is only fair, right? But Clint’s done playing games, yours and your sisters. Truth is coming out and you can’t stay away from Clint.

Upast’ zamertvo – Drop Dead


He looks from the cookie in his hand to her disappearing upstairs. He sighs, shaking his head. He knew it was pushing her. She was ready. He was being selfish and knew it, but she was so close he didn’t know what he was supposed to do with that. He heads through the house, voices pulling his attention. Steve, Sam and Peter are standing in the living room.

“We see you Parker.” Steve comments.

“I’m just being nice.” Peter grins. Clearly none of them realize he’s joined. He leans on the frame of the opening.

“You’re trying to get points with her.” Sam points out.

“Jealous?” Peter chuckles.

“Bribing her with cookies?” Sam scuffs. “Child’s play.”

“Cause you’ve what got an in with her? What with the shot?” Peter snorts. Clint smirks, they were arguing about Y/N, that was cute. Like do they know she would literally eat them alive just cause she was bored.

“PTSD, we have something in common. A comfort of know she’s not alone.” Sam gives a smug smile.

“You’re both wasting your time.” Steve chuckles.

“What are you going to do?” Peter laughs. “Give her a fight for freedom speech?” He scuffs.

“Or just blush and babble in the corner till she notices you?” Sam adds.

“Beside why would she want with an old guy?” Peter snorts. Clint shakes his head, this kid and his old comment.

“I mean,” Steve shrugs, lifting the bottom of his shirt, flashing off his stomach. “and I’m the perfect guy. Literally.” Steve smirks. Clint shrugs, nodding, Steve wasn’t wrong. He was literally the perfect guy, scientifically perfected.

“I’m a genius.” Peter shrugs, lifting his own T-shirt, showing off his own stomach. “Besides, touch her mind, and her body will follow.” Peter throws his hand up. “Boom.” He has a smug grin on his face.

“Damn, that was fucking good.” Sam and Steve exchange a look. Peter shrugs, looking like he won. He turns, stopping when he see Clint.

He bites into the cookie, chuckling.

“Oh, hey Clint.” Peter looks a little awkward suddenly. The other two look as well.

“You know she will pick you apart for fun than eat you alive, right?” Clint chuckles.

“Who?” The three of them ask together.

“All of you.” He laughs, shaking his head. “Don’t believe that sweet smile and bat of her eyes. You know a widow lures her prey in with the promise of sex, than she kills him.” He nods.

“How do you know?” Steve looks as if he wasn’t sure if he should believe him.

“I’ve known the Romanov Sisters for many, many years. I’ve watched her work.” He shrugs. She was too much for sweet, innocent and good guys like Steve, Peter and Sam. She was dark, damaged and a little wild.

“That doesn’t put me off.” Sam shrugs.

“Spiders are good for each other.” Peter smirks.

“Just means she needs real strength to handle her.” Steve nods. Clint laughs, popping the rest of the cookie into his mouth.

“She’ll eat you alive for sport.” He chuckles, walking away.



——-



He jogs to catch up to her in the hallway of the training unit.

“Y/N?” She stops turning to look at him.

“What do you want, Barton?” She rolls her eyes.

“What are you doing?” He tries to ask calmly.

“Going to team training?” She shrugs.

“No with the guys.” He sighs. “You have Steve, Sam and Peter tripping over themselves to get your attention.” He points out.

“Why does it matter to you?” She hisses. She had a point. He didn’t have a right to care, he ended things with her.

“We both know you would destroy them.” He lifts a brow.

“Sort of like you did me.” She smirks. She shifts, suddenly cold and smug.

“Y/N,” he grinds out.

“Shove that apology, Barton.” She hisses. “I don’t want it or need it. What I do with anyone else is none of your business. Understand?” She lifts a brow.

“Are we really,”

“What? Don’t act like you’re jealous.” She snorts, cutting him off.

“And if it’s not an act?” He asks. Shock registers on her face suddenly.

“Why would you be jealous? Remember, you didn’t want me.” She bites out.

“Maybe I didn’t have a choice, Y/N.” He retorts. “Maybe you don’t know the story.”

“Maybe I don’t want it anymore.” She snaps. “If you are jealous, get used to it.” She shrugs.

“God damn it, Y/N.” He growls, getting annoyed with her.

“Too many years too late.” She hisses. “I don’t want your excuses cause you’re jealous someone wants me, when you discarded me.” She reminds him. She might as well have kicked him in the ribs.

“Walking away doesn’t change we need to talk.” He calls as she turns getting a short distance.

“Upast’ zamertvo.” She flips him off. ‘Drop dead’ from a Russian is a hell of a threat.

“Yeah. Yeah.” Clint calls. “I probably would if you talked to me.” He sighs. She doesn’t stop or turn back, heading into the training room. Leaving him stewing in his own bad discussions and regret alone in the hallway.
